page.title: 12Bristows Helicopters
page.content: They are the largest operators at the largest{Heliport}in the world, Aberdeen. The scale of operations is huge. Bristows alone operate 63 flights a day, about 1200 men, mostly going to the oil rigs in the North Sea. Even though chances of crashing are infinitesimal there are quite a few warning lights to warn a pilot of a malfunction, 137 in all. No wonder then that it takes 9000 flying hours and Â£60,000 to train a man to be a pilot. And as he sits in his technological nest does he reflect that the rotor blades above his head, spinning at 500 mph,cost Â£40,000 each? But that is just a fraction of the Â£1.5 million cost of the whole helicopter. And as more oilfields are discovered in the North Sea, the future of the world's largest{Heliport looks very bright indeed.
